com.wiris.quizzes.api.ui

Interface MathViewer


  • public interface MathViewer
    Helper class for displaying MathML and graphic content. In some technology or integration contexts it may be preferable to use the MathType Plugin to display MathML content. See http://www.wiris.com/plugins/docs for more information.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void filter(java.lang.Object root)
      Render all the MathML expressions and plot all the constructions inside a HTML page.
      void filterConstructions(java.lang.Object root)
      Plot all the Graph constructions inside a HTML page.
      void filterMathML(java.lang.Object root)
      Render all the MathML expressions inside a HTML page.
      java.lang.Object graph(java.lang.String construction)
      Use Wiris Graph to create a live view of the construction, presented in the GeometryFile format.
      java.lang.Object plot(java.lang.String construction)
      Draw a construction, presented in the GeometryFile format, with Wiris Graph.
      java.lang.Object render(java.lang.String mathml)
      Draw a MathML expression using MathType so it can be displayed.
      java.lang.Object renderCorrectAnswer(QuestionInstance instance, Slot slot, AuthorAnswer authorAnswer)
      Render the value of the correct answer contained in the given author answer, using the syntax of the given slot.

    • Method Detail

      • renderCorrectAnswer

        java.lang.Object renderCorrectAnswer(QuestionInstance instance,
                                   Slot slot,
                                   AuthorAnswer authorAnswer)
        Render the value of the correct answer contained in the given author answer, using the syntax of the given slot. If the author answer contains variables that could be expanded using the data in the question instance, expand them. This is a helper function that calls either render(String) or plot(String) depending on whether Slot.getSyntax() is SyntaxName.MATH or SyntaxName.GRAPHIC.
        Returns:
        An HTML element in JavaScript.
        Since:
        4.1.0.

      • render

        java.lang.Object render(java.lang.String mathml)
        Draw a MathML expression using MathType so it can be displayed.
        Returns:
        An HTML element in JavaScript.

      • plot

        java.lang.Object plot(java.lang.String construction)
        Draw a construction, presented in the GeometryFile format, with Wiris Graph. Only available in JavaScript.
        Parameters:
        construction - A construction in the GeometryFile format.
        Returns:
        A HTML element containing the canvas with the plotter. This element does only contain the canvas with the plot. It does not allow the user to perform any actions such as zoom in or out, animate the construction or to pan over the it.
        See Also:
        graph(String)

      • graph

        java.lang.Object graph(java.lang.String construction)
        Use Wiris Graph to create a live view of the construction, presented in the GeometryFile format. This allows the user to zoom in or out, to animate the construction or to pan over it. Only available in JavaScript.
        Parameters:
        construction - A construction in the GeometryFile format.
        Returns:
        A HTML element containing a live graph with the given construction.

      • filter

        void filter(java.lang.Object root)
        Render all the MathML expressions and plot all the constructions inside a HTML page. It calls the methods filterMathML(java.lang.Object) and filterConstructions(java.lang.Object). Only available in JavaScript.
        Parameters:
        root - The HTML document to be rendered.

      • filterMathML

        void filterMathML(java.lang.Object root)
        Render all the MathML expressions inside a HTML page. Only available in JavaScript.
        Parameters:
        root - The HTML document to be rendered.

      • filterConstructions

        void filterConstructions(java.lang.Object root)
        Plot all the Graph constructions inside a HTML page. Only available in JavaScript.
        Parameters:
        root - The HTML document to be rendered.
